For the second time in as many months, Afghan police have launched an attack on U.S. soldiers. This most recent attack, which came in the form of a policeman attacking a U.S. foot patrol by throwing a grenade and opening fire, resulted in the death of an American soldier. Source: TrulyNewsworthy.com. 
 
 As terrible a tragedy as this is, I believe the fight must go on in Afghanistan. I should also point out that, counter to any initial opinions, I am for closing down the war in Iraq.

For the second time in as many months, Afghan police have launched an attack on U.S. soldiers. This most recent attack, which came in the form of a policeman attacking a U.S. foot patrol by throwing a grenade and opening fire, resulted in the death of an American soldier.  As terrible a tragedy as this is, I believe the fight must go on in Afghanistan. I should also point out that, counter to any initial opinions, I am for closing down the war in Iraq.

 
 Unfortunately, the quoted post shows a lack of knowledge when it comes to Afghan history.
 
 Since the days of Jengis Khan, the Afghans have fought to repel all foreign invaders - the British, the Russians, and now us.
 
 They may hardly be what others call "civilized", but they hae been doing things their way for 1,500 years.
 
 Russia had its Vietnam in Afghanistan, must we have a second one there as well?

I want to know! Only think of it! Highly sensitive documents on Iraq war has been stolen (!) after being left unguarded (!) on a train from London to the Leeds. As reported in our press a certain lawyer, who "worked for British Government, could not fit his suitcase with secret (!) papers into the overhead storage space and had instead stowed it in a baggage rack at the end of the carriage"! Who are ready to eat such ####?
 Moreover, this incident is simply the latest in a long of embarrassing losses of government information (timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/uk/crime/article5755728). As sure as a gun that this enterprising lawyer has seized the occasion of full incompetence of our governmental authorities, dared to send secret documents in ordinary trains, and has sold the confidential information of our military at a high rate to al-Qaida's agents, who have invaded this country now! It is likely that there are a lot of similar traitors among our corrupted functionaries. It proves that we should wage war not in Iraq or Afghanistan, but, first of all, here, in Britain! 
 We are sick and tired of these incidents and governmental excuses of them which are full of ####! It is clear as a day that we are simply in urgent need of quick changing present government!
This bot is quick off the mark, it only happened this morning! (GMT)
